article.title: Trinity, a Maison emblem and jewelery icon test long artcle
article.dek: Created in 1924 by Louis Cartier, the Trinity ring soon became one of the emblems of the Maison and a jewelery icon.

items.article_body:
The Mainson’s registers from 1924 make the first mention of a ring consisting of three inseparably interlaced bands, each made of a different metal: platinum, pink gold and yellow. A bracelet with han identical concept was also created the same year.

The clean-lined design appealed to Elsie de Wolfe, famouse American interior designer, who would be the first to purchase one.

News combinations of colors were introduced over the years. While the most emblematic joined yellow, pink and white gold, Cartier also dared to introduce audacious hues, such as green gold.

Beyond Timeless

A timeless piece, it’s essential design is at the same time femenine and masculine, symbolic and playful. The harmonious interplay between the three bands provides an unprecedented expression of attachment.

The trio of gold holds a powerful metaphor:

  • Pink for love
  • White for friendship
  • Yellow for faithfulness

Beyond Timeless

A timeless piece, it’s essential design is at the same time femenine and masculine, symbolic and playful. The harmonious interplay between the three bands provides an unprecedented expression of attachment.

The trio of gold holds a powerful metaphor:

  1. Pink for love
  2. White for friendship
  3. Yellow for faithfulness

More than a symbol of love, the pureness of its lines also offers multiple interpretations.

quote.content: Iconic? Perennial? Ubiquitous? None of these seems strong enough to describe the Panthére within the design oeuvre of Cartier.

A favorite amongst artists

Cartier Stockholm was first international jeweler to open its doors in the city—and represents our first step into the Scandinavian market. Here’s everything you need to know about the boutique and its importance to the Maison.
